com.mapmyfitness.android.mmfremoteappexample.app.com.mapmyfitness.android.mmfremote
Class RemoteManager.Builder

java.lang.Object
  com.mapmyfitness.android.mmfremoteappexample.app.com.mapmyfitness.android.mmfremote.RemoteManager.Builder
Enclosing class:
RemoteManager
public static final class RemoteManager.Builder
extends java.lang.Object

This builder is used to create this class with the desired parameters. The only that is required is a android.content.Context so we can try to bind to the app and retrieve information about the packages installed in the phone. Below is an example of how it can be used. 

     RemoteManager.Builder remoteControlBuilder = RemoteManager.getBuilder();
          remoteControlBuilder.setContext(this);
          remoteControlBuilder.setStatsCache(mMmfStatsCache);
          remoteControlBuilder.setDataListener(this);
          remoteControlBuilder.setCommandListener(this);
          remoteControlBuilder.setAppPackage(AppPackage.MAPMYRUN);

          try {
              mMmfRemoteManager = remoteControlBuilder.build();
          } catch (RemoteException e) {
              Log.e(TAG, e.getMessage(), e);
          }

Method Detail

setContext

public RemoteManager.Builder setContext(Context context)
Set the android.content.Context for the Activity, Service, or Application you wish to bing to the MMF apps. This is REQUIRED, otherwise the build() method will throw a RemoteException.
